testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlDetectorMaintenanceHistoryRequest dialog as an EC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.6.1.4 [Need for Data Collection System Metadata] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine the dialog performance requirement for Send Detector Maintenance History Information Upon Request (NTRM 3.3.5.2.4.1}. RECORD this value as: TMDD_N108R492_Send_Detector_Maintenance_History_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter = ${TMDD_N108R492_Send_Detector_Maintenance_History_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter}

Step 3 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Authentication - Device Information (DeviceAuth) is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.1.1.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R364_Authentication___Device_Information__DeviceAuth__Supported = ${TMDD_N108R364_Authentication___Device_Information__DeviceAuth__Supported}

Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Operator Identifier - Device Information is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.1.1.2.1.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R365_Operator_Identifier___Device_Information_Supported = ${TMDD_N108R365_Operator_Identifier___Device_Information_Supported}

Step 5 CONFIGURE: Determine whether External Center Organization - Device Information is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.1.1.2.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R366_External_Center_Organization___Device_Information_Supported = ${TMDD_N108R366_External_Center_Organization___Device_Information_Supported}

Step 6 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Device Identifier Filter is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.1.1.3.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R367_Device_Identifier_Filter_Supported = ${TMDD_N108R367_Device_Identifier_Filter_Supported}

Step 7 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Roadway Network Identifier Filter is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.1.1.3.2). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R368_Roadway_Network_Identifier_Filter_Supported = ${TMDD_N108R368_Roadway_Network_Identifier_Filter_Supported}

Step 8 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Link Identifier Filter is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.1.1.3.3). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R369_Link_Identifier_Filter_Supported = ${TMDD_N108R369_Link_Identifier_Filter_Supported}

Step 9 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Route Designator Filter is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.1.1.3.4). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R370_Route_Designator_Filter_Supported = ${TMDD_N108R370_Route_Designator_Filter_Supported}

Step 10 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Linear Reference Filter is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.1.1.3.5). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R371_Linear_Reference_Filter_Supported = ${TMDD_N108R371_Linear_Reference_Filter_Supported}

Step 11 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Detector Station - Detector History Request is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.2.4.2.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N108R495_Detector_Station___Detector_History_Request_Supported = ${TMDD_N108R495_Detector_Station___Detector_History_Request_Supported}
Step 12 CONFIGURE: Define the response message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: ResponseMessage: ${ResponseMessage}
Step 13 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the Authentication parameters need to be verified within this test. RECORD this information as: AuthenticationCheck: ${AuthenticationCheck}
Step 14 CONFIGURE: Identify the Username expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Username: ${Username}
Step 15 CONFIGURE: Identify the Password expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Password: ${Password}
Step 16 CONFIGURE: Identify the Operator Identifier expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: OperatorID: ${OperatorID}
Step 17 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT will be allowed access to the information requested in this test. RECORD this information as: AllowAccess: ${AllowAccess}
Step 18 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 19 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}
Step 20 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT is expected to have valid data available for a response message in this test. RECORD this information as: DataValid: ${DataValid}

Step 21 REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-RECEIVE with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDetectorMaintenanceHistoryRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N108R492_Send_Detector_Maintenance_History_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter AUTHENTICATIONCHECK = AuthenticationCheck USERNAME = Username PASSWORD = Password OPERATORID = OperatorID ALLOWACCESS = AllowAccess ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected DATAVALID = DataValid

Step 22 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps. Note: If a verification step fails, then test execution will proceed at the next subsequent Post Condition step, if present. Otherwise, test execution will proceed to the final Exit step.
Step 22.1 VERIFY that an organization-information data frame exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header
Step 22.2 VERIFY that a device-type data element exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header
Step 22.3 VERIFY that a device-information-type data element exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header
Step 22.4 VERIFY that a detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg message was received.
Step 22.5 VERIFY that a device-information-request-header data frame exists within message detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.
Step 22.6 VERIFY that data element device-information-type is set to device maintenance history.
Step 22.7 VERIFY that data element device-type is set to detector.
Step 22.8 IF TMDD_N108R364_Authentication___Device_Information__DeviceAuth__Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.8.1 VERIFY that an authentication data frame exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header
Step 22.9 IF TMDD_N108R365_Operator_Identifier___Device_Information_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.9.1 VERIFY that an operator-id data element exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header.authentication
Step 22.10 IF TMDD_N108R366_External_Center_Organization___Device_Information_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.10.1 VERIFY that an organization-requesting data frame exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header
Step 22.11 IF TMDD_N108R367_Device_Identifier_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.11.1 VERIFY that a device-id-list data frame exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header.device-filter
Step 22.12 IF TMDD_N108R368_Roadway_Network_Identifier_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.12.1 VERIFY that a network-id-list data frame exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header.device-filter
Step 22.13 IF TMDD_N108R369_Link_Identifier_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.13.1 VERIFY that a link-id-list data frame exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header.device-filter
Step 22.14 IF TMDD_N108R370_Route_Designator_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.14.1 VERIFY that a link-designator-list data frame exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header.device-filter
Step 22.15 IF TMDD_N108R371_Linear_Reference_Filter_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.15.1 VERIFY that a linear-reference data frame exists within each instance of data frame detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.device-information-request-header.device-filter
Step 22.16 IF TMDD_N108R495_Detector_Station___Detector_History_Request_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 22.16.1 VERIFY that a detector-station-id data element exists within message detectorMaintenanceHistoryRequestMsg.
Step 22.17 VERIFY that the values within the REQUEST message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 22.18 CONFIGURE: Set CONTENTVERIFIED to True

Step 22.19 POSTCONDITION: REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-REPLY with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDetectorMaintenanceHistoryRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED=TMDD_N108R492_Send_Detector_Maintenance_History_Information_Upon_Request_Parameter CONTENTVERIFIED = CONTENTVERIFIED RESPONSEMESSAGE = ResponseMessage
Step 23 EXIT
